ygData.msgSnippet: sheesh,  I better get on my horse. I should  have some time to work on it tomorrow.  Is there a problem with just reading the file in parts, through a buffer,

sheesh,  I better get on my horse. I should  have some time to work on
it tomorrow.  Is there a problem with just reading the file in parts,
through a buffer, and writing it to another file?  That way it's not
necesarry to actually load the whole file in memory, it just converts
it.  Of course that won't be much good for the scenario editor, but for
a file conversion utility it should be ok right?  Now if I could only
remember all the basic stuff I used to know about C programming ;�

Deathifier wrote:
> 
> Just want to let everyone that isn't yet bored with programming stuff that I
> finished off debugging the scenario file loading function and it now appears
> to be functioning properly :)
> 
> For the other coders the only real trouble I had was getting the linked list
> to function properly and then setting up the variables properly - remember
> to NULL terminate any strings you have, even ones that shouldn't need it
> (like the reserved data portion, although you could also ignore it) - I had
> a rather interesting multi-hour session working out exactly what was causing
> the problem, being told that the crash was occuring somewhere inside a small
> block stack something was not helpful, and that it only affected 1 in every
> 50 to 100 objects was also not so helpful.
> *Run program, hit breakpoint just before crash, analyse next object, it
> looks fine, just like any other object, press continue and crash*
> 
> I took a couple of screenshots - one of the pile of code I stuck in to help
> find the bug (turned a 1 line function into a 10 line function) and one of
> the interface.  While I doubt they'd be terribly interesting my ISP has
> screwed up anything but HTTP access to my site (and a few other aussie
> sites) so I can't put the screenshots up until I blast the twits tomorrow
> about the problem.
> 
> The only other interesting situation I had was with reading in text lines -
> when you read in the line length of the next line make sure you check that
> it doesn't have 0 characters (which represents a blank line in the game).
> If you are using ReadFile() from the Win32 API you'll find that if it is
> successful but the number of bytes read is 0 it signals the file pointer was
> past the end of the file - so if you tell it to read 0 bytes you can produce
> a false error :)
> 
> Ah well, I'm still on track to have it done within a couple of days, the
> rest should be a lot simpler.
> 
> Oh, and DPH - I ran it over that 200k scenario file in your torture pack,
> and it only took a second or two to load (P3-800), we'll see how long it
> takes to write it back out :)
> Lastly, I'm thinking about adding in a compare ability to the converter so
> that you can make sure two scenarios are the same and that the conversion
> process works.  Any ideas if this would be useful outside the converter?
> 
> Enjoy yourselves,
> Deathifier
> 
> The Gladiator Mailing List
> 
>
